docs.snippet: The latest on developments in financial markets (all times local):

headline.print_headline: Markets Right Now: Indexes Gain, but Oracle, Facebook Sink
headline.main: Markets Right Now: Indexes Gain, but Oracle, Facebook Sink

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc Chief Executive Mark Zuckerberg said on Wednesday that the social media company made mistakes that allowed data about users to end up with the analytics firm Cambridge Analytica and said the company would make changes.

headline.print_headline: Zuckerberg Says Facebook 'Made Mistakes' on Cambridge Analytica
headline.main: Zuckerberg Says Facebook 'Made Mistakes' on Cambridge Analytica

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc will be removed from the Australia-based BetaShares Global Sustainability Leaders Exchange Traded Fund (ETHI) due to recent "controversies", its Responsible Investment Committee (RIC) said on Friday.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Dropped From Australian Ethical ETF After Data Breach
headline.main: Facebook Dropped From Australian Ethical ETF After Data Breach

docs.snippet: A fake Facebook post is spreading fears that venomous snakes are lurking in the sewers of a Georgia town, and the city attorney has expressed concerns to the social media network that it's creating confusion and panic.

headline.print_headline: Fake Snake Post on Facebook Prompts Fear in Georgia Town
headline.main: Fake Snake Post on Facebook Prompts Fear in Georgia Town

docs.snippet: Stocks that moved substantially or traded heavily Monday:

headline.print_headline: Facebook and Newell Brands Skid While Orbotech Climbs
headline.main: Facebook and Newell Brands Skid While Orbotech Climbs

docs.snippet: Facebook's latest privacy scandal, involving Trump campaign consultants who allegedly stole data on tens of millions of users in order to influence elections, has some people reconsidering their relationship status with the social network.

headline.print_headline: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks
headline.main: Breaking Up With Facebook? It's Harder Than It Looks

docs.snippet: Germany's justice minister Katarina Barley has asked Facebook to clarify whether the personal data of the social media site's 30 million users in the country were protected from unlawful use by third parties, according to a report in the Funke gro...

headline.print_headline: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report
headline.main: Germany Summons Facebook Over User Data Safety Concerns: Report

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc said on Friday it was suspending consulting firm Strategic Communication Laboratories (SCL) and its political data analytics firm Cambridge Analytica after it found they had violated its policies.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Suspends SCL, Cambridge Analytica for Violating Policies
headline.main: Facebook Suspends SCL, Cambridge Analytica for Violating Policies

docs.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.

headline.main: Vladimir Putin, Facebook, White Rhino: Your Wednesday Briefing

docs.snippet: Asian shares fell on Tuesday after investors took profits in high-flying U.S. technology shares on fears of stiffer regulation as Facebook came under fire following reports it allowed improper access to user data.

headline.print_headline: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks
headline.main: Asian Shares Fall as Facebook Data Flap Spooks Tech Stocks
